title: missing specialization: `<encoder::EncodeContext as SpecializedEncoder<rustc::hir::def_id::LocalDefId>>::specialized_encode` not overriden

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

body:
```rust
#![feature(conservative_impl_trait)]
#![feature(const_fn)]

pub struct S;
pub const fn f(t: S) -> impl Fn() {
    move || {
        &t;
    }
}
```

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.25.0-nightly (97520ccb1 2018-01-21) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'missing specialization: `<encoder::EncodeContext as SpecializedEncoder<rustc::hir::def_id::LocalDefId>>::specialized_encode` not overridden', libseriali
ze\serialize.rs:788:9

```

(EDIT: I don't think that's the right backtrace)

For context, a few modifications and the resulting compile:

- Remove `const` => clean compile
- Remove `move` => ``error[E0373]: closure may outlive the current function, but it borrows `t`, which is owned by the current function``
- Remove `&` in closure => ``error[E0507]: cannot move out of captured outer variable in an `Fn` closure``
